clinical_study.brief_title: Anterior Segment Spectral-domain Optical Coherence Tomography in Patients With Closed Globe Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Anterior Segment Spectral-domain Optical Coherence Tomography in Patients With Closed Globe Injury

brief_summary.textblock: This study use anterior segment spectral-domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT) to exam patients with closed globe injury, and compared with slit lamp examination. The results showed that OCT can identify features of closed globe injury that were otherwise not visible on slit lamp biomicroscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: The anterior segment architecture changes of closed globe injury patients include corneal damage, hyphema, angle recession and lens dislocation, which can be showed with OCT. OCT was superior to slit lamp biomicroscopy examination in detecting anterior segment architecture changes, especially in the presence of media opacities.

primary_outcome.measure: anterior segment spectral-domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT) findings in patients with closed globe injury
primary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 hours after patients were admitted

intervention.description: Anterior Segment Spectral-domain Optical Coherence Tomography

study_pop.textblock: patients with closed globe injury were recruited, and all eyes of recruited patients had hyphema occupying at least 1/3rd of anterior chamber volume

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with closed globe injury were recruited; had hyphema at least 1/3 of anterior chamber volume
Exclusion Criteria:
- can not cooperate with examination
